author: Jeff Parsons
title: How your iPhone can save your life: simple trick tells emergency services your medical information
text:
A little-known feature on the iPhone could help to save your life by revealing important medical information to the emergency services.
Apple's Health app was introduced in iOS 8 and will continue into the upcoming iOS 9 release .
The app includes an option called Medical ID, which lets you create a list of medical conditions, such as allergies and current medication as well as important information like blood type.
The Medical ID app shows all your vital medical information
It can be accessed from the lock screen in the event of an emergency.
So if an paramedic arrives to the scene of an accident and you're unconscious - your iPhone could save your life.
Here's how to set it up Open the Health app Tap the Medical ID option on the bottom right of the toolbar Choose 'Create Medical ID' Fill in all the relevant information Enable the "Show When Locked" option How it works The Medical ID can be viewed from the lockscreen
The Medical ID can be customised with a picture and date of birth.
When the lock screen appears, a small tab saying "Medical ID" will be visible when you swipe to enter an emergency call.
It means that a first responder or medical official can see your important information handily laid out, and it could mean the difference between life or death.
Privacy concerns Apple's Medical ID description
While Apple doesn't store any of your personal medical information on its servers, your Medical ID will be viewable to anyone who can physically get to your phone.
If you ever want to delete your Medical ID, you can do so at the bottom of the edit screen.
